reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like the French Quarter but don't want to stay right in it, this is a great location. But, the Staff is what will make your stay an incredible experience. From information on where to dine, relax, or tour they were all very knowledgable and always went to great lengths to make sure we had the best experience possible in Nola. This will be my 3rd stay at IH and I will definitely be going back soon.
reviews.title: Incredible Staff

reviews.text: The rooms are small, poorly finished-out, and noisy. There is almost zero deco in the rooms, which is fine, I guess, but it felt a little sad and tired. The bed was okay -- certainly not the kind of bed you get at a Westin, for example. I would have rated this hotel lower, but the lobby is very nice and the service was pretty good.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: If you need to stay in that area, I would try the Omni across the street, the nearby Hilton, or even the Intercontinental (which has larger rooms and more amenities).
reviews.title: Did not stay on last trip to NOLA and sure wish I had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On last trip to NOLA chose a hotel close to airport for convenience. Never again. I missed the IHH, a beautiful, fun and funky boutique hotel. It's in a great location close to the quarter but not too close so you can enjoy the quiet. We hosted a large scale work event at the conference center and held a block of rooms. I was pleased with the service, loved the bar attached to the hotel and had great eats at the restaurant. (Scott at Rambla knows his wine and if asked, will put together an impromptu and delicious wine tasting). As well, the bartender at Loa seems more like an apothecary to me with the fresh herbs, plantings, assortment of old fashion glasses and colorful mixers that adorn the bar. The lobby by far is the most beautiful part of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our first visit to New Orleans, and it was perfect. The staff is incredible-- particularly Justin-- who generously gave us invaluable information on the music scene and made our trip the absolute best. It is wonderful to stay in a small, well-run hotel. It's a short walk to the French Quarter, and easy to get a cab when needed. We had a small, but comfortable room. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Good Service, Accomodations and Great Price

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the International House recently while we were doing some volunteer work in New Orleans. The hotel lived up to most of the previous reviews, but I would caution anyone staying in a Panoramic Corner King Room as the street noise is overwhelming! Between people shouting on the street and constant trash pickups, we got little or no sleep our first night. The front desk was very helpful in accommodating our request to change rooms for the remainder of our stay, and I highly recommend booking a room on the Penthouse Floor if at all possible. There was no street noise whatsoever, and the view was terrific.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend this hotel to couples or business travelers. We had dinner one evening in Rambla which is attached to the hotel and the food was good, although the restaurant never seems to be busy like most other New Orleans establishments. The hotel bar, Ioa, is right off the lobby and is a very nice place to relax after a long day exploring New Orleans.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Great staff. Great Location

reviews.text: Great hotel walking distance from many great attraction. The front desk staff are a great bunch. Had a wonderful time at this hotel. Only stayed 1 night so didn't get a chance to experience it too much but no complaints for sure!
reviews.title: Love at first sight
Good value
reviews.text: With so many options in New Orleans, I was looking for a hip and cool place to stay. The International House met my expectations and I loved the stylings of everything from the Lobby to the sleek rooms. Equipped with amenities like aveda bath products and apple tv, I couldn't heip but feel content as it felt just like I was in a boutique in Chicago or New York but with a more reasonable price. The location was wonderful and because I was traveling alone I felt extremely safe walking to and from the French Quarter at all times (took a cab if I was staying out really late). I'm already looking forward to visiting in May and while I was thinking of trying something new, but I may just have to stay here again.
Nice rooms. The bar in the lobby was incredible! Short walk to the FQ. Coffee shop attached to hotel.
reviews.title: Tasteful Treat

reviews.text: Not friendly.
reviews.title: Disappointed. Big bummer. Never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No umbrellas (or appologies) on a week of torentially pouring rain.
reviews.title: Great stay for a great price

reviews.text: They were not proficient or comfortable giving directions, shopping suggestions, or even having an all inclusive map of NO. Very strange.
reviews.title: Great for work or play

reviews.text: The concierges were very sweet, one offered me her personal umbrella, but the manager was down right chilly, and again, had 1001 "good reasons" for not having any umbrellas for guests, not even for the doorman, who was only present on the day we left.
reviews.title: IH is a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, to be clear, in the pouring March rain, we had to run 3 blocks to the Marriott to buy 5 dollar ponchos! Thank god they were selling them. And they were so friendly! By the time we got the ponchos we were totally soaked, and my brewing head cold turned into the flu as I froze my butt off until I got back into bed, where I ended up spending the rest of my trip after making our soaking wet meetings.
reviews.title: La Quinta is Next Door...Better Luck There

reviews.text: The experience I had at this hotel exceeded my expectations. The service from every employee encountered was at least pleasant if not more, the ambiance was great and I thought the location was superb. I would definitely return and encourage others to give it a try.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at his hotel as part of a group of 22 for 2 friends 20th birthday. I really enjoy boutique hotels and have stayed at many. I know going in that if it is a renovation of a much older space that I am taking a gamble. International House is a beautiful space in a great location just outside the quarter. Upon entering the hotel I was delighted by the electic glamorous feel of the small space.
reviews.title: Beautiful design concept but very poorly maintained and they don't honor your room selection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My delight quickly turned to frustration when I got to te reception desk. Upon check in I was told we had been upgraded to a room with a view. Normally this would have been a pleasant surprise but since I had specifically booked the Rock Star (windowless) room for our stay this was not a welcome upgrade. I politely declined the room with the view and let the clerk know that I had been looking forward to my windowless room which I had booked almost 2 months prior. At this point she informed me that in actuality the no longer had any windowless rooms available. I offered to wait until one was made available and was again told that they were all occupied. Interestingly enough our friends that arrived a few hours later were given a windowless room and when I called the front desk to inquire about how they were able to get the windowless room I was told, very courtly, they had specifically reserved that room almost a month ago and that in the future I might consider doing te same if I wanted a specific type of room. Our friends booked their room AFTER we booked!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The room itself was so tiny there was not even room for a small chair. The size really wasnt an issue though as that is pretty common with boutique hotels. What wa surprising was the condition of the room. The wallpaper was peeling from the floor and ceilingin th bedroom and bathroom. The headboard was vinyl and had pen marks all over and the wall had multiple scuff marks. Oh and the upgraded window room with a view. Our view was of a wall of windows and the tops of other buildings. When the sun came up the next morning there was no option of sleeping on because even with the drapes pulled shut the room was bathed in light so I was wide awake both Saturday and Sunday morning by 6:30 am. Not exactly a relaxing weekend.
reviews.title: FIRST VISIT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other lowlights:
reviews.title: Something different, and very welcome!

reviews.text: After spending two (non-consecutive) nights here, this is was our experience:
reviews.title: Not a good experience!

likes.liked: — Quality of room, service and attitude of staff

reviews.text: -The hotel's restaurant was non-existent, and the staff had no idea when/if anything would be going into the vacant space.
reviews.title: International House is Hip, Fun

likes.liked: — ambience, people and value; bathrooms are nice
likes.disliked: — rooms can be small (but who cares?)
